## Training materials for applied epidemiology and public health {.unnumbered}

**This website strives to:**

-   Serve as a home for Applied Epi^TM^ training materials\
-   Provide problem-based teaching to address common epidemiological
    challenges\
-   Assist epidemiologists transitioning to R\
-   Be accessible in settings with low internet-connectivity via offline
    versions

community. Your encouragement and feedback is most welcome:

-   Tweet [**\@epiRhandbook**](https://twitter.com/epirhandbook) or
    [**\@appliedepi**](https://twitter.com/appliedepi)
-   Submit issues to our [**Github
    repository**](https://github.com/appliedepi/applied_epi_training)

**We offer live R training** from instructors with decades of applied

around the world drawing upon experience with organizations including
local, state, provincial, and national health agencies, the World Health
Organization (WHO), Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors without Borders
(MSF), hospital systems, and academic institutions.

This website is **not** an approved product of any specific
organization. Although we strive for accuracy, we provide no guarantee
